intro: Rhyncospermum, commonly known as the Australian thistle, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plants typically have spiny leaves and produce showy, yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Rhyncospermum species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to withstand arid conditions. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
